intro: Astracantha adanica, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Astracantha adanica is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal practices.
